recipe.name: Sirloin Steak with Pesto, Bell Peppers (Capsicum) & Flatbread
recipe.description: Beef is like wine. You get what you pay for. So if you invest in a good steak, keep it simple and concentrate on the sides to serve up a dinner that will make any meat lover beam with pleasure.
recipeIngredient: 2 x 10oz / 300g   sirloin beef steak (, 2.5 cm/ 1 inch thick (the best you can afford))
1  red bell pepper ((capsicum), deseed, halved and sliced into strips)
Pesto ((preferably homemade - see notes for recipe))
Flatbreads ((see recipe Easy Soft Flatbread (No Yeast)))

recipeInstructions.text: Preferably bring your steak to room temperature. This will take 30 minutes if the air temperature is warm/hot, or an hour if it's cool.
recipeInstructions.name: Preferably bring your steak to room temperature. This will take 30 minutes if the air temperature is warm/hot, or an hour if it's cool.

recipeInstructions.text: Season steaks generously with salt and pepper. Do this just before you cook it.
recipeInstructions.name: Season steaks generously with salt and pepper. Do this just before you cook it.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a heavy based fry pan over high heat until it starts to smoke.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a heavy based fry pan over high heat until it starts to smoke.

recipeInstructions.text: Place steaks in the fry pan. Cook each side for 2 minutes for medium rare. See notes for cooking times.
recipeInstructions.name: Place steaks in the fry pan. Cook each side for 2 minutes for medium rare. See notes for cooking times.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove steaks from the fry pan onto a plate and cover loosely (not tightly) with foil. Allow to rest for 5 minutes, up to 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove steaks from the fry pan onto a plate and cover loosely (not tightly) with foil. Allow to rest for 5 minutes, up to 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: While the steak is resting, return the fry pan to the stove over medium high heat with 1 tbsp oil.
recipeInstructions.name: While the steak is resting, return the fry pan to the stove over medium high heat with 1 tbsp oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the bell pepper (capsicum) and cook, stirring occasionally, until nicely charred. Remove from heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the bell pepper (capsicum) and cook, stirring occasionally, until nicely charred. Remove from heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the steaks topped with the bell pepper and with Pesto and Flatbread on the side.

review.reviewBody:
Man, wish I could easily get nice sirloin cut in Beijing! Now you really make me jealous!
I still remember the nice cut from whole food when I was visiting the US. I LOVE steak. I usually don't need anything go with it and just need the meat, but your flatbread and pesto idea sounds really awesome!
I love steak but I'm not a big meat eater.  I like a bit of the beefy flavour and then I eat all the vegetables. This looks so good I might eat more than a little bit.

I'm also more of a white meat (or tofu) sort of person, but my boyfriend really likes steak. I think he's going to go nuts over this dish!  I like the pairing with flat bread and bell peppers - that flatbread looks especially tasty.

Nagi, it looks amazing and I can't wait to try this recipe! Sirloin is my favorite kind of steak and I'm always looking for new recipes. Together with the peppers, pesto and flatbread, this is my type of meal!
